alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 04 at 3:42PM MST until July 04 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Western Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 445 PM MST. * At 342 PM MST, areas of blowing dust was along a line extending from 20 miles northwest of Saddlebrooke to 10 miles southwest of Picacho Peak State Park, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 206 and 230. Route 79 between mile markers 94 and 128. Route 87 between mile markers 116 and 124. Locations impacted include... Eloy, Picacho, Chui-Chu, Picacho Peak State Park, Red Rock, Cactus Forest, Shopishk and East Chui-Chu. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
